description: Italian schiavone, referring to the Slavs of the Doge's bodyguard.

entries.meaning: (historical) A backed, hilted broadsword of the 17th century.
examples: Once back aboard the raft and still in the grip of those tentacles, it was O'Rourke's assignment to stand quietly while his partner took a schiavone, a two-edged basket-hilted sword he had picked up in Italy, and methodically whacked off the arms of the octopus.
